Review_Title: Great mixer grinder for the price paid!!
Author: Nishant Lala
Review_text: Hey everyone, few weeks ago received this mixer grinder and I have bought this for Rs 1699 during the sale. This is a good mixer grinder for the price you are paying so let me start with my review.# Packing & Box Contents :- The packing done by Amazon was worst but the product was not damaged.* In the box you will get 3 Jars, the machine, user manual & warranty card.# Build Quality :- The build quality of the machine is good and it has a anti skid feet it does not slip's unnecessary while using.* And now coming to the quality of the Jars are good & durable.# Capacity of the jars :-1.25 Litre liquidizing jar,0.88 Litre multi purpose jar,0.3 Litre chutney jar# Functionality:- The motor is very powerful so it does makes noise.* The blades of the jars are very sharp it does the job very quickly.* It is very useful for grinding many items like liquid items or dry items.* It has a 3 speed control so that the speed can be increased without overloading the machine.I will definitely recommend you to buy this mixer grinder this is a good grinder for the price paid.I have attached few images of the mixer grinder.Thank you for reading my review. Hope it helps you!!Regards,Nishant Lala.

Author: A Discerning Buyer
Review_text: My last mixie was a Morphy Richard, which I used & used for more than ten years. It was a great mixie, but everything has a shelf life! This time, just to try out a different brand, I decided to buy a Philips or a Bajaj mixie. The Bajaj worked out much cheaper, and I have been using it for 2 months now. No complaints at all, it's a tough little machine, and I've been using 2 of the jars on a daily basis. Hope it lasts as long as my last mixie! The only misadventure that I've had with it was when I once used it for too long, continuously...like maybe for 2 minutes non-stop.  The machine seized up, and I had to reset it by pressing the button at the bottom. But that's a precaution one has to take with ANY mixie...don't use the machine continuously, give it short breaks. I'll be careful in future

Review_Title: No special safety features like in the Panasonic MX-AC400
Author: Myrre
Review_text: The mixer is worth it's price I feel. No special safety features like in the Panasonic MX-AC400. Not very silent either but didn't expect that in this price range. The functioning of the mixer is quite alright. One star less is for the plastic and the insulation ring. The plastic used in this mixer still stinks bad after a months. (The lid seems to be better I think, but the bottoms of the jars stink terribly) And any food item that comes on the insulation ring and sits there for a little more time than a few seconds tastes bitter. Very questionable!! Would have loved to pay a little more for better quality plastic and rubber!

Author: Vijay Rao
Review_text: After my hand blender conked off I was looking for a replacement mixer grinder which was more reliable and easy to clean/use. I landed on the cheapest mixer/grinder by Bajaj - this model.This is a basic mixer grinder. It has 3 power/speed levels and one pulse mode (incher). The mixer comes with 3 jars - 300 ml, 800ml, 1300ml. These are perfect for making milk shakes, juices, puree, chutney, batter, etc. In my opinion, this is a must have for any person wanting to cook meals or prepare shakes/juices for oneself. It greatly reduces preparation time. The jars are easy to clean because of the steel finish of the material. The blades are efficient and combined with the power of the motor, it takes just a few seconds to get your job done. Absolute value for money.

Review_Title: Very low quality. Broke in a week. Warranty is practically useless.
Author: Hazem
Review_text: The blade of the 0.88L multi-purpose jar broke off in one week's use. That's when I see that it has a plastic thread and is broken. Called the bajaj electricals customer service and I was told that a service representative will call me in 3 days. No one did after 2 weeks. I called them again and my service request was assigned high priority. I was called from the customer service on the same day and I was told that I have to carry it to the service center which is about 20 km away. The time and money I have to spend to get to the service center is higher than getting it repaired from a local shop nearby. I bought this because of the average reviews in amazon and relatively low cost. Bajaj? Never again. Just should have sent some extra bucks and bought a reliable brand like Philips.

Review_Title: Jar's blade came apart upon second usage
Author: Chinmay
Review_text: This product is listed as the "#1 Best Seller" in mixer grinder category on Amazon. After going through a few models, we decided to order this. Packaging was good and product arrived on time (thanks to Amazon Prime). Fast forward to second round grinding and there was a loud noise (other than the usual mixi sound). After checking that nothing had broken inside, we proceeded. Later while washing the jar, we realized one of the blade has broken and come apart. This was the smallest jar. Blades seem to be made of plastic and even very light usage lead to the plastic getting heated up pretty quickly. Thankfully we were able to return the item back to Amazon and get a refund.So look out for the unusual sound and be on a lookout for the plastic breaking apart. Because sooner or later that is bound to happen!

Author: Tarun
Review_text: Bajaj Rex 500 Mixer Grinder is an average product.I buy it onlineIts specification is something like that1) Power rating 500 watts(It is actually the motor rating)2) voltage 230V- 50Hz3) I got 3 jars of different size(large, medium & small) with this product . The jars are made of stainless steel. and the quality of its, is quite goodThe main problem of this product I experienced after using it for two months or so.when It is working its make a huge sound which is quite noisy.you have to hold the jars tightly when it is grinding as it is jerking a lot.after 20- 30 sec of grinding you will still find it is not grind the ingredients properly.so I would suggest you increase your budget and go for a good one.

Review_Title: Amazon please do the quality check to ensure Happiness is spread.
Author: Sandeep Sandhu
Review_text: This is my 2nd bad review since I started shopping on AMAZON in 2013. Amazon looks not focusing on "QC Passed" or quality check and trusting on vendors for what they supply.I was happy that the product I ordered arrived 2 days in advance of proposed date and was delivered to me on Oct 11, 2016 (Dusehra) instead on Oct 14. I was very happy and thought of making shake. I cleaned all jars but when I plugged it in power it didn't run. I then went to another room considering the plug might not be working but didn't turn up in 2nd room too.I was bit sad as I had to return it and will take another 4-5 days including pickup and exchange. I flipped upside down and had a glance inside through the vents and there was something unusual, "RESET" button at the bottom had only one wire attached and was the only visible and expected two. I was in dilemma whether to it myself and repair or return.I then opened it myself and surprised seeing the unplugged wire, the holder of the wire slipped and thus was the open circuit and didnt let the Mixer run. I fixed that and then it was running.But if I gifted it to someone and this issue would have embarrassed me? or would have resulted spending extra money on repairing ? Or what if Amazon would have refused on taking it back saying electronic/electric appliances are not accepted under return/replace/refund and exchange?Cons:1. Bit Noisy2. Jars are not that greatPros:1. Very Powerful2. Looks SturdyAmazon please do the quality check to ensure Happiness is spread.

Review_Title: PLZZ....people do read my problems. before purchasing... expected something better
Author: Desai Vimith
Review_text: Expected a better product from Bajaj. Pros Beautiful andsleek design The lid and gasket design is quite good, fullysealed and avoids spillage. ConsLot of noise of different kinds - squealing, cracking,whistling etcfrom different parts of the mixie while it is running NoiSealso means vibration causing doubts on long term usageofthe productThe blades are bolted from bottom, which means in orderto clean thoroughly,you need to open both sides(the blade on one side andthe gear wheel on the other). There is danger ofloosing(many) washers while doing so. This is more adesign issue.The plastic mixing handle with wrench can only be usedfor the first twojars. The smalljar blade nut size is different.The bigjar blade is very small compared to thejar and soyou need to spend moretime and effort to grind. Even then it does not grindcompletely. Otherjars are okay from this point of view.In the bigjar, the nylon washer at the inside bottomstarted peeling off after 3-4 uses.With the fear of plastic getting into food, we stoppedusin the bi'ar.

Review_text: I bought this mixer for Rs 1800 recently and have asked for a return for the item mainly because of these problems:1. Blades too small to grind anything properly. Can't even grind a mango properly for a shake.2. Makes too much noise almost as if it is going to break whenever you use it.3. The plastic of the covers is so poor that it actually cracked in just applying pressure to keep it in place.4. Heats up very fast.The only up side is the price. And obviously ordering from Amazon because you can return if you are not satisfied with the product. Otherwise, I'd suggest to add a little more money and go for a more robust mixer.

Review_Title: Invest more and get a better product
Author: Purav Agrawal
Review_text: Very average product.  Bought it being one among cheapest but not really worth it.Cons:1.  The lid are not airtight and you have to apply pressure from top while running the mixer.  Also there is whole in the top lid so you have to cover it otherwise, leaks could happen.2.  Making and Steel used are of average grade at best.3.  Grinding and Blending is not that great, requires to be run for longer time at higher speed for proper grinding and mixing.I didn't had much idea about buying mixers and now can see that "What you pay is what you get"Its okay for 1700 Rs or so but would suggest people to invest more and get a better product.Thanks.

Review_Title: Just a showpiece that barely meets the need
Author: Sunshine
Review_text: Expected a better product from Bajaj. Here is our experience with the product.ProsBeautiful and sleek designThe lid and gasket design is quite good, fully sealed and avoids spillage.Cons- Lot of noise of different kinds - squealing, cracking, whistling etcfrom different parts of the mixie while it is runningNoise also means vibration causing doubts on long term usage of the product- The blades are bolted from bottom, which means in order to clean thoroughly,you need to open both sides (the blade on one side and the gear wheel on the other).There is danger of loosing (many) washers while doing so. This is more a designissue.- The plastic mixing handle with wrench can only be used for the first twojars. The small jar blade nut size is different.- The big jar blade is very small compared to the jar and so you need to spend moretime and effort to grind. Even then it does not grind completely. Other jars are okay fromthis point of view.- In the big jar, the nylon washer at the inside bottom started peeling off after 3-4 uses.With the fear of plastic getting into food, we stopped using the big jar.Unfortunately, by the time we realized the problems, we already exceeded theduration of returning the item to Amazon.Not recommended even after a big discount. Hope the company takes note offlaws and improves the product.

Moreover, the quality of the main mixer and the jars is very poor. They look and feel cheap. They don't even seem new. The jars I got had scratches all over them. Also, the white you see in the photos is not white. It's like bluish white. I'm the kind of person who tries to find the best in everything, but this one got even me. In the end I'll just say, if you plan to buy this because it's "super silent", think again!

Author: PM
Review_text: Bought this mixer after a lot of research and reading of reviews online. The 750W motor is powerful, and does the grinding in a short amount of time .But the jars provided are of poor quality, and not upto Philips standards. The cover of one of the jars fell once from the kitchen shelf and promptly broke in the first fall. Though it claims be be made of strong poly carbonate material, it's of poor quality. We have had previous mixer jar covers made of polycarbonate , which never broke even on multiple falls.  The jar handles keep coming loose and you have to tighten them regularly with a small handle screwdriver ( and longer screwdrivers do not fit inside the jar horizontally ). Also, within 3 months of usage , one of the steel jars showed a crack near the lid. ( Similar to the low quality rolled steel utensils sold in local shops ). We were disappointed with this quality of the jars and now looking to claim warranty on this steel jars which have developed cracks.  Overall a poor choice considering that the jars don't go a long way, and the fact that other jars don't fit this mixer.

Review_Title: Absolute Piece of Crap - Donate your money to charity instead.
Author: Ashutosh A.
Review_text: The worst possible way to spend you money. Whoever designed this piece of crap must not have even gone to kindergarten. Even the  last ranker in a batch from an engineering school will design something better. The list of defects is endless. The very purpose of food mixing / processing is extremely difficult for it to handle.- The blades are so poorly designed that your food will get stuck inside it and there is absolutely no way for you to clean them. In a humid weather like Mumbai, you will get fungus unless you are a superstar with a magic trick to clean. You wouldn't seen such a design disaster.- The lid will just fly off as soon as you turn it on. I don't think I am asking too much, If I am looking for the lid to be there when I have filled it in quarter of its capacity.- The build quality is super horrible. I dont think Philips could have found out cheaper materials than the ones they used for this piece of crap..............  I can go on and on about it. This is undoubtedly the worst thing I have ever bought in my life. Writing this review with a hope that you don't end up wasting your precious money on this stupid piece of crap.

Review_Title: Not silent but a good mixer-grinder nonetheless
Author: Akash Kumar
Review_text: A mixer-grinder is a common kitchen appliance so I will just list the pros and cons of this model rather than going into generic details.PROS:(1) Having 4 jars is a big plus as you can use separate jars for different purposes. In other words, no garlic flavor in a fruit smoothie.(2) Powerful 750W motor does the job a lot quicker than the standard 500W or 600W motors.(3) Has a good suction base so the device stays stable during operation.(4) Rubber gaskets on the jar covers are removable without much effort so the jars are relatively easier to clean.CONS:(1) BIG CON: This is not at all silent, but perhaps makes less noise for a 750-watt motor. I checked at a local store before buying and this made almost the same noise as another brand's 600W motor and definitely more than most 500W motor mixer grinders. Philips NEEDS TO drop the 'Super Silent' verbiage from the product name.(2) The handle of one of the jars does not feel secured properly. I fear that it might start leaking in the future.(3) The steel jars are thinner and lighter as compared to other brands. But the quality of the stainless steel seems good, so it should not impact the durability of the product.(4) As one would expect from a non-dedicated device, the juicer is useless for juicing any hard fruits or veggies like carrots, beets, and apples.*UPDATE on 11-JAN-2015:* I have been using this mixer-grinder for three months now. All of my earlier observations have turned out to be accurate. As for the slightly loose jar handle, I was able to fix that issue easily by tightening the screws on the inside of the jar. No leakage so far from any of the jars. Also, the motor is so powerful that I haven't had to put the grinder on High speed even once! One Tip: Try not to inadvertently block the little pinhole in the middle of the jar covers with your palm while putting them on the jars. Otherwise, it's a struggle to push the jar covers down. The covers will slide all the way down very smoothly if the air is allowed to be expelled via that pinhole as you push down.If you found this information helpful, please hit yes below to encourage me to write more reviews :)

Author: Leona459
Review_text: I will break my review into 2 parts:1. Purchase, shipping and deliveryI have purchased this mixer in a lightning sale on Amazon. So I bought it at a substantially lesser price that is currently listed on the date of this review.As smooth as the purchase was, the delivery was altogether another issue. Being a regular office-goer, I was not able to take the delivery on weekdays. The day the courier was assigned for delivery, I had contacted Amazon to re-schedule the same to a weekend delivery. According to the number of CSRs I spoke with, the time of delivery can be communicated only once the courier is assigned. However, after repeated communication by chat and phone, the courier person had come over 3-4 times during the weekdays. Finally, he just delivered to my neighbor's house without even informing me. This is the first order I have had delivered at home. Otherwise, any delivery to my office has never had any glitches. It would be great if Amazon allowed for a preferred time delivery.2. The Mixer itselfThe pros:1. The stainless steel of the jars and the plastic of the handles seems to be of good quality.2. The flat white jars lids shown in the picture are of good quality too.3. The plastic used in the jar lids has not absorbed or retained any odor after washing and hax not stained.4. The material put into the mixer does not stick to the sides while grinding and that makes the grinding a very clean process.5. The mixer jars are easy to clean.6. The base is firm and the mixer does not have a problem standing it's ground.7. The blades are sharp and the motor is powerful enough so grinding takes a shorter time.8. Compact so doesn't occupy much space.9. Packaging was done carefully and the mixer was well protected in the box.The Cons:1. As mentioned by other reviewers, the "Super Silent" description is definitely misleading. However, the noise is not as jarring as with some other mixers that I have checked out. It is a smoother, like a well-oiled machine, though I have not had it long enough to confirm that it will stay that way. It may sound harsh and unpleasant later like at which point I will update this review.2. The transparent plastic dome lid for the larger wet grinding jar seems flimsy.3. The base of the juicer jar is again the transparent flimsy material and any crack in the jar will make it absolutely useless. Considering the quality of the plastic of the base, the probability of that happening is high unless treated with kid gloves.4. The seal on the lids of the jars can be improved.As is evident, I feel that the pros outweigh the cons. That is the reason for the 4 stars.

Review_Title: safety-hazard avoid purchase of this mixer grinder
Author: DD
Review_text: Dangerous jar included in this purchase of model HL 1645 / 750W. The big stainless steel jar with transparent dome lid is very dangerous. it will push all wet contents forcefully all over wall and on your body (warning we got burned and whole kitchen got messy) . This will happen even if you push the lid with your hand. Yes! I tested this jar at home I guarantee my statement. When I tried to post this comment on philips site they refused to publish my comment. But there was already review from another buyer mentioning this issue on philips site.Look for models where the big jar has atleast three clamp type lid-lock on it. Stay away from this model, motor is too strong for our hands to stop the forceful throw-up of contents.

I already own a Philips mixer blender, which does not have such sharp poor quality plastic. Even the steel of jars is very thin and light unlike my old mixer. Review_Title: Neither Silent Nor Heavy Duty But Gets The Job Done!
Author: shrikant
Review_text: The "Super Silent" tag as explained by other over here is simply a marketing gimmick, this mixer makes as much noise as any other. However when you consider that this is a 750Watts machines the amount of noise that this mixer makes is fairly less, I have seen 600 watts mixers make much more noise than this guy. Now the jars and all are pretty light when compared to brands such as Preethi and Sumeet, etc. however again they get the job done, they are not heavy duty but fairly strong. I say this as I dropped the big jar and thought it would have a crack or cut, but it didn't barely a scratch even. Hence i have given it 4 stars! The juicer jar is pretty good now in the summer to make cocktails, etc. The machine seems good enough for the past month or so of usage, no leaks, no problems, let's see how long this goes on.Now Amazon did delver the product pretty late, though it was sent via Fedex they had some technical difficulties and i got this product a week or more from the date i placed the order, the funny part was the product was delivered from my own city where i live and still this happened. That was the only sad part of buying this product, as i have never faced any such problem with Flipkart or Snapdeal.

It takes weeks to get the spare part, you have to keep calling them to remind every few days to make sure your part is ordered. It's a mess, you'd find it better buying a new mixer grinder than getting a spare part. Absolutely poor service and very disappointing particularly from a British company.

Author: JPJ
Review_text: There were some claims of the motor being more silent that most others, but that is not the case.  It's as loud as most other 750W grinders are ... no less, no more.The design is compact, and the exposed coupler design is unique and innovate, as it makes cleaning of the grinder unit very easy.  The flip side is that after market jars cannot be used with this grinder, as the jars have a unique "inverted cup" design that is meant for this exposed coupler design of the grinder.Performance is good, both for wet & dry grinding.  However, the quality of the jars is just about par for the price, and doesn't feel as well built and sturdy like an older Kenstar 600W model that we'd been using for the last 8 years or so.  Also, the blender jar is conspicuous by it's absence, though it can be bought as an extra attachment by contacting Philips customer care.The blender jar is a standard fitment with the HL 7715 model, but will work with the 7720 also, as they both share the "exposed coupler" design.Would have given it 5 stars, had the jars & attachments been of better quality.

Author: Sumit
Review_text: Perfect product. Its too good. Blindly go for it. Overall product quality is very good as a premium product with premium pricing. Bang for bucks in the range of 3000 to 3350/= The jars are of good quality. I like the way the jar fits to body. I dont think think its noisy even it is having 750watt motor. Chutney jar is 400 ml which some people may find small (other brands u may get 350ml for lower value products) but its perfectly fine when used for grinding chutney. Other two jars are of big size and serve the need.This Philips VIVA series has three models in grinding (forth one for juice only). This is the middle model with 750watt motor which is most powerfull in the series.2) HL 7710 : This is with 600 watt motor with slightly less price (need to ckeck always as the price sometimes more than HL 7720 model)Philips HL 7710 600-Watt Mixer Grinder with 3 Jars (Pistil Red/Bright White/Cashmere Grey)3) HL 7715 : this model is with 700watt motor and its a JUICER. For multi-purpose family who prefers making juice in home can go for this. Its the costlier in the series and sold around 5000/=Philips Viva HL7715 700-Watt Juicer Mixer Grinder with 3 Jars (Pistil Red and White)Hope this info will give you a basic idea and may help to freeze your mixer purchase decision.Note: This one is of very good quality and you wont get the same product/feature in low priced product. I bought cheaper one from reputed brand for my mother, but when I used this, Its always better in every aspect. More money but better product and satisfaction.

Author: HUGO C ALVES DOS SANTOS
Review_text: One of the main things that stick out of this blender is its power - it really works. So make sure you have the lid tight closed and hold it when you start blending it!!! I used the small one to grind some almonds but I left it for too long and as it's so powerful it became a paste - I need to learn and do it little by little probably. It will blend anything and it's great if you want to blend vegetables for lots of goodness into a soup!!! Be careful of blending hot things as the steam can build up the pressure and explode - it happens to us twice. So better to wait for things to cool down or put small quantities inside and watch carefully! But all in all I'm extremely satisfied with it.

Author: Ashish Pradhan
Review_text: Don't quite like the detailing of joints especially in the jars,handles and blade mounts. Motor has power but its noisy. I had a problem with the seller who delivered the wrong model number. Such sellers should improve their internal quality and dispatch system. Price is good though.

Author: Jigar Patel
Review_text: One of the worst mixer/grinders I have purchased till date. I have absolutely no idea why this has so many positive reviews. Initiated the return procedure within just a few hours of opening it.The lids of all the jugs are supposed to be held firmly by the rubber padding along the circumference of the lids, but in this model, as soon as I turn the product ON, even on minimum speed, the lid vibrates and pops open which results in a spill. One has to constantly keep one hand on the lid to keep it firmly shut and prevent spillage. Even the pictures we not adequate. I feel Phillips has falsely advertised this product.Furthermore, the rubber padding along the lid doesn't look like it will last more than a year due to wear and tear. I wish I could give this product ZERO stars. Flawed design. Would have preferred the lid to have some locking mechanism so that it can be shut tightly.

Review_Title: The only review you'll need to read.
Author: Siddharth Singh
Review_text: It's a mixer grinder. It does what it says on the box and does it well. The 750 watt power adds a good punch. The parts fit each other very smoothly and snugly and there seems to be no need to hold down the jars while the machine is in use. Of course, with as much power there will be the noise factor, but if you have endured any hardships in life then you'd probably not complain about such petty stuff. I have not put this machine through any endurance tests, but for my needs - mostly juices and chutneys - this machine far exceeds the intention of it's form and function. Overall, I have found this product to be of great value for it's price. There were no shipping delays, and the order was received in perfect conditions. The only botheration that was endured was in giving directions to the delivery guy who just didn't seem to understand that he was in fact standing in front of my house.

Review_text: Very Average Product But at this price we can not complain.What you get in the BOX - >Mixer3 Jars3 Covers for the Jars.Some Useless Warranty card which was never filled.The Mixer itself isnt very heavy. Feels light and doesn't feel well built.Plastic seems to be of the Cheap Quality.Bottom of the Mixer is the Reset button and if you look closely you can see several wires dangling here and there.The Jars are made out of Metal, But they are made from Very cheap low Quality metal. Very thin doesn't feel sturdy at all.Power Cord length is very average, Power Cord thickness and Quality is Poor! Very thin cable and very poor Connector.The Button to operate the Mixer seems to be Flimsy and looks like it might break any moment.Product doesnt seem to be assembled well. I doubt this would last very long. But we will just have to use it and try.Overall a very very Average Product. Please do not buy this expecting class Quality. This maybe Branded Prestige but it doesn't have the "Prestige Quality"

The three jars are made of good stainless steel and the lids each have separate ring to make them air tight while in operation. For instance, we were able to grind some grams into fine powder in about half a minute, which is much quicker than our previous grinder.

Author: Drvk
Review_text: I got it under lightening deal.Overall, i am not very satisfied with the product.1) It is by far the loudest mixer i have come across. it sounds like a jet engine at takeoff. Unbelievably loud. You just cant use it when people are sleeping. if you are planning to take it abroad, be careful. Your neighbors will 100% lodge a complaint on you for creating noise.2) The rubber shoes at the bottom: flimsy.  one of them has already come off and it is not easy to fix it back.3) Chutney jar does not have a handle. It fits very very tight into the mcahine, so it is very difficult to twist and take it off. At times, my wife needs my help as the chutney jar gets stuck in the mixer.In terms of performance - it does it's job. it grinds coconut and other hard material also without any problem.

Review_Title: This mixer grinder is your best friend if you like making different types of smoothies, curry dishes and chutneys
Author: nupur agarwal
Review_text: Ever since I have moved to Mumbai, the only thing that clouds my mind is- What should I get for my kitchen, how should I make my home more beautiful, what furniture would look good or what kitchen ware can resolve my cooking blues. Yes, I have become homely like that but I feel it is with every person whos staying alone and is used to of a perfect house. A kitchen is the most important part of the house after your bedroom, especially if you come from a house which has everything you can possibly think of in the kitchen and one thing I always knew was, my kitchen needs to have a good Mixer & Grinder.So the day Maharaja Whiteline sent me this beautiful piece of technology, I was elated max! As the name suggests, the Joy turbo indeed brings joy and happiness to any humans life who likes to cook and experiment in his/her kitchen.This product has solved all my issues like making chutneys and juices at home.  The plastic body boasts of light-weight construction and compact design. It comes with 3 jars for different types of grinding and juicing. The motor is quite powerful and this mixer grinder is equipped with stainless steel blades for durability and strength. As compared to similar products that are available in the market, this one saves you from any installation process and the stainless steel body retain the shine and look of the machine. Non slip jars and steady handles makes it easier to pour stuff out of them. It comes with three types of jars- Mixer grinder, Liquidizing jar (1.5 liter), Dry and wet grinding jar (1 liter) and Chutney jar (0.3 liter).Some important points to remember-This product does not require installation.Do not worry if you experience some burning smell when you run your mixer grinder for the 1st time .This is due to the motor varnish getting heated for the 1st time.  The problem should not recur in subsequent uses.Since your mixer grinder runs on a powerful motor, there will be some noise. If the noise level seems abnormal, please contact Brand Service CenterStainless steel jarsSafe with non-slip feetErgonomic handleDurable stainless steel jar.Warranty: 2 years on product and 5 years on motorPower: 750 wattsOperating Voltage: 220-240 voltsIncludes: Mixer grinder, Liquidizing jar (1.5 liter), Dry and wet grinding jar (1 liter) and Chutney jar (0.3 liter).
Review_helpful:
|

Review_Title: Good for basic work, bad for heavy duty grinding
Author: kanti kiran
Review_text: I am writing this review after using it for more than 4 months...The product is good but for a very basic use of grinding chutneys,powders and  mincing.  Though it has 750 watts motor it doesn't deliver on heavy duty.  I had issues with it and had to call service guy thrice in 4 month.  Whenever I make idly or dosa dough (which is general practice at my home and had used earlier mixer grinder for 5 years without issue)  it stops after 2 mins and doesn't come back to use for hours, at time a day.The reason  for choosing this product is because of 750 watts heavy duty motor and it is disappointing to see it doesn't deliver.If you have basic job,  this is a good product.

Review_text: The product is good in terms of motor performance. We are facing a peculiar problem with it. The rubber attached on the legs came out within 3 days. He did the fix but again it came out. After some more days another rubber came out.Pros:1. Good machine with good condition.2. All the attachments are in good condition.Cons:1. Minor problem which may create bigger issue.2. Sound a bit more if you compare other models from Morphy rechards, philips etc.3. Service might be a problem as nearest Prestige centers don't entertain online customers. You have to find authorize service centers.Final verdict: Visit to your nearest electronics seller, choose model after running it there itself. Look out for deals online or in the store itself and then buy your any electronics product.

Review_text: This product stopped functioning withing 1 month of use.I called amazon they asked me to contact the prestige service centre .I  took the mixie for repair and they did something immediately to the roter and gave it back .I used it again just once when it stopped functioning again.I called the service manager and asked him if the product could be replaced as the problem seemed recuring and a manufacturing defect.He said he would speak to the GM and that went on for 4 weeks .After which he stopped picking up my calls .then when I persisted he smsed me his bosses phone no .The boss never picks up his phone and till date not picking up my call .Will Amazon help?What is my fault here ?That I bought this faulty product ?Prestige as a company should be ashamed to have no policy to help  like me .They also need to train their employees on customer service and how to pick up calls .Shame on Amazon for promoting a company like this .I am not buying any product from this portal henceforth.I will be taking this matter up with the consumer forum and I hope I can get redressal soon.

Author: Wizardofid
Review_text: The good. The small/ dry/ chutney jar and blade work superb.The bad. The gasket split (picture attached) in 3 uses. Also the other two jar and blade combinations ultimately work slower than our previous Philips 600W mixer grinder, which this replaced. The plastics and rubbers aren't as good as the Philips in quality and specification.UPDATE 7 Months: Spindle Adaptor at the motor came off. The Grinder blade in the Medium/ Large size jar loses smoothness in rotation because of debris getting stuck inside. If you buy this remember to always place the jar upside down after washing, or open up the blade assembly often (like we do now) to clean. Good thing is that the service centre in Jayanagar Bangalore, replaced the adaptor, and loosened the blade bearing very quickly.

Review_Title: Bought this after my Philips super silent mixie for last 6 years showed symptoms of ...
Author: Brij
Review_text: Bought this after my Philips super silent mixie for last 6 years showed symptoms of jar wear and tear. Totally shocked to see such a substandard product from a so called Popular brand. Absolutely poor quality of plastic and rubber. It has been a month and still it gives out bad odours (Burnt plastic/rubber)from the Jar during and after even short usages. It is just not able to grind coconut for chutney completely. The same job is completed by Philips in less than a minute. Yesterday, my wife was trying to extract butter from milk cream. It couldn't? get it. Finally she transferred the contents into my old work horse and with in 15 sec the job was completed. It is clear that this bloody company has no R&D facilities and they are just manufacturing and pushing to market. It sounds like rock crusher and irritating. Pleay go for some reputed company who actually review the performance and improve the product. Go for Philips or Panasonic. Not happy with the sealing of chutney jar of Philips.

Review_Title: The product is amazing and we liked it a lot
Author: Sreekanth
Review_text: Hi My name is G Mamatha and I am Sreekanth's wife. The product is amazing and we liked it a lot. Earlier , we have a Sumeet Mixer grinder at home which was also good but it became old so we bought this new Preethi Blue Leaf. It is great. We liked  the look, its Performance. The jars are of good quality, lids are tight and unbreakable. I have not yet used all the jars like juicer etc but the wet and dry grinding jars are good. The motor seems to be powerful and the noise levels are moderate for a 750 Watt mixer. We have reviewed other brands like Philips, Butterfly, Morphy Richards etc before ordering this online through Amazon. Couple of points from my husband;Noise level - My sons can sleeps just next room when the grinder runs! That's acceptable for me.Jars - Pretty strong; Handles: tightened with screws so easy to fix by ourselves in case of any loose ends. But they are very well fixed and no such problem.Blades - 1/2 kg Wada batter was done in just 4mins, very strong bladesLids - reinforced with double rubber lining, so they are very tight and leak proof.Easy to stir - The main jar has a small opening on the lid top, so very easy to stir and add water as required without opening the whole lidcompact and less space consuming.Over all, the product is very satisfactory.

Review_Title: Amazon was selling this a good amount lesser than other online sellers and the delivery ...
Author: gaurav pande
Review_text: Being a north indian, I"m thankful to my friends from the south to have introduced me to the largest selling mixer grinder in India. It's a superbly made machine. 'Those who have been using the regular mixer with 600 Watt motor will be in for a pleasant surprise when they see the ease with which the 750 watt motor does what was such pain in the ass with the regular 600 watt grinders (I was using a Maharaja mixer grinder before this).The jars are made for Indian type of grinding and are couldn't have been sturdier. My sis got a food processor for my mum and when she came to be with me she says that she wants this machine.Before buying I figured that this variant of Preethi (Blue leaf Platinum) enjoys a lot of trust among the south Indian ladies and now I know why..Amazon was selling this a good amount lesser than other online sellers and the delivery was prompt typical Amazon style making you feel high end..So all in all a very satisfying experience

Review_Title: Better to buy such products from a shop rather than buying online.
Author: Aakanksha
Review_text: The product was looking good. While using it for the first time I smell something burnt so I put the mixer off thinking it would be my imagination, but again after 2-3 days when I used it same thing happened and I could also see little smoke. I took the Mixer to Preethi Service Centre where I was told that, the motor was bad and it didn't have CUT OFF SWITCH which this product should have had.The technician by the name of Krishna immediately replaced the motor and now my mixer is working fine and with better speed..Now I feel it is always better to buy such products from retail shop though it might be little expensive.Just because I faced this problem I came to know the motor was not the original one with cut off switch.

Author: H K AGRAWAL
Review_text: This product is called Platinum and carries a higher price tag, but is only as good as their low end models.It is good as a very basic Mixer, GrinderBut the new attachments and functions like Juice extractor jar, vegetable grating etc do not work well. They only add to the price and not to its functionality.When I complained, they sent a technician (customer service responsiveness was good) who said that the Blade Of my brand new one day old juice extractor was defective (so much for quality control).He changed bade but it made only a minor improvement.My recommendation: Please buy only basic mixer grinder model. Avoid buying such fancy models. You will save lots of money and also avoid the frustration of trying to make new attachments work.

Review_Title: Sleek and Powerful Mixer-Grinder Gets Job Done While Looking Good
Author: Vivek K.
Review_text: Sleek design and multiple cups make this a great gift item, my wife loves it. We already had a Bajaj food processor from our wedding but the lids had started to leak and the base takes up a lot of room on the kitchen counter. This little guy fits nicely on the counter and the multiple bowls means you don't have to wash it as soon as you use it if you need to mix up something else. The sizes are practical and the design is elegant. Also the lower wattage (500W) means we can run this on our UPS if we need when the current cuts, but it is still strong enough to finish the job quickly and properly.

Author: Ritesh
Review_text: We purchased this mixer for 3 reasons- 750 watt power supply- 2 jars out of 3 has clipped lids- Reviews by Amazon usersThe worst purchase from Amazon till date. This review is after using the jar for 5 days1. Although it claims to be stainless steel the body of jars have started rusting (picture attached)2. A 750 watt power supply of this mixer is supported by such badly designed blades that it is unable to make even a smoothie with cashews, soaked almond and tender dates.3. The lid of chutney jar is extremely loose. Spills completely if pressure applied on the lids while grinding is not enough.4. The jars have a peculiar smell after grinding or even washing. Smell looks like something is melting. Even my completely dried jars have that smell.I wish I could go back and change my decision of purchasing this one

Review_Title: Substandard heavily leaking jars is twister is all about
Author: Amazon Customer
Review_text: Following is the first hour report. (Shall update after a week)Hmm, The Large Jar and the medium jar leaks from the rivete points at the bottom (inside where the coupler is fixed) at the rate of 1 drop/10 seconds and eventually it leaks from the coupler case over the body. The steel used for the Jars is low gauge.The rubber washer is stiff and the contents heavily leak through the lid clip at the rate of 3 drops / 1 second, creating a twister of mess on the tableI give one star as the jars are leaking profusely from the lid clips and from the rivete .Product : Fresh (Unused)Body looked as promised and the it works par with 750W motor. The machine is very light and there is nothing inside the extended plastic case that claims too much space in my little kitchenDelivery was 2 days earlier - ExcellentPacking - ExcellentI have not used it for processing any food. The test was done with water. I shall update this review after using it for a week.UpdateRice soaked for 6 hours ground to a paste in 2 minutes(Primary grinding was one minute and secondary grinding was after 1 hour which was another one minute)Urad dal soaked  for 6 hours ground to a paste in 1 minute.2 cm cut coconut pieces (about 200 grams) was ground to .25mm sized pate in 2 minutesCONCLUSIONThe product does its job without a doubt.Sound is par with any other 750W mixieLeaks are a concern. I found that if you go with 50% less content than the company claims, it works without leaks, that is 250 grams at one go.

|

Review_text: The finish of the body is not very good, especially the plastic. The lids of the all the jars came off very easily and did not have any vacuum when placed over the jar. Lids without clips generally require the user to place a hand over it when the mixer is in operation. But because these lids were unusually loose and did not have any suction, the user has to apply more pressure and cannot take the risk of not holding it, even if the quantity of the liquid inside is less. For the cost, maybe these standards should be expected but I have returned the product as I was not satisfied.

No protection to stop starting without jar in place.  Absolute no for a family with kids. That should just be basics for any product like this. There is no information or videos available online to show how to use the equipment. Just some marketing video with a lady dance rotating saying this is elegant. Just don't buy it. There are far better products. I hate being cheated and when it's my own mistake of not checking I really hate it.

Author: Ipsita
Review_text: I got it thinking that it will be good for a single person usage. After a month(used 4 times..each time for 1 medium sized diced tomatoes and 1 small onion), the blades of smallest jar broke when in use.After making banana and strawberry smoothie for some 7-8 times, blades of the biggest jar broke.The medium jar ran "long". After 15-20 times of use (used it for same purpose as smallest jar), the blades amd nut broke when in use.Cleaning was tough because of blade positioning. Even if it looks clean after 1st wash, you can find residue near/under the blade.Since all jars have broken down, I looked for single separate jars, but nobody keeps them in stock.As far as the main body is concerned, it can still function.  But no point without the jars. It is noisy too but that was never my concern.I regret buying this. Do not fall into trap by buying a cheaper grinder. In the "long run", it actually proves costly( 80 to 90 rupees per usage in my case). An average range grinder would give less than 40 rupees per usage, easy.
